justification: When applying the inclusion criteria the authors state they only accepted studies that "involved selecting between two or more options before acting," i.e., decision-making tasks built from 360° immersive video presentations.

topic_or_construct: transfer of learning from VR to real-world performance
measured_by: on-base percentage in real baseball games
justification: Describing Gray (2017), the review notes that far transfer was assessed "to on-field performance, measured here with the on-base percentage in real games over 5 years."

"Response Correspondence addresses how similar the primary type of response required when performing MPT is to the typical natural skill execution… we ranked papers… by assigning each paper a number from 1-10."
Under the Visual Correspondence section the authors explain that they "ranked" each study on this dimension, assigning numerical scores on a 1-10 scale based on graphical fidelity.
Stimulus Correspondence "is influenced by… Behavioural Correspondence," and, like the other MPTF dimensions, the papers were "ranked" from 1 to 10 along this behavioural realism scale.
